reviewText: This was overall a pretty good DVD. Taylor Wayne and Frankie Cullen getting it on in the gym was the best scene in this movie. Watching her on the exercise bike was mesmerizing. Taylor Wayne's the reason I purchased this DVD.

This is one of those movies you see on Cinemax at night "After Dark". For some reason many of the ones you buy have some sort of editing done to make them "R" or something and aren't how they appear on t.v. That isn't the case with this one and it is as it was shown on t.v. (at least how I remember it anyways). The women are gorgeous and in various states of undress, the story is pretty much there to explain why the ladies are getting naked, and it moves along from one scene to the other. I don't know why I like this particular... Cinemax after dark movie bur for some reason I do. Maybe I just like Glori Anne Gilbert. Anyways the movie is pretty good for what it is and if you can get it at a good price go for it and add it to you other naughty DVDs. Note that the same locations seem to appear in Witches of Breastwick (both 1 & 2) and even some of the actresses are the same just switching parts around. If you like any of these three movies you may want to just go ahead and get all 3 to throw on your DVD rack. Witches of Breastwick/Witches of Breastwick 2
Thought it was great.  Glori-Anne Gilbert is my new favorite softcore model. She wore a dark wig, but you can see a little blonde hair underneth. A MUST BUY!

I would call this soft porn if there had been any sex in this film.  Mostly female nudity, while in hot tubs or in the bathtub.  As for a plot - well, the woman of the town are brainwashed to be sex slaves.  Really, did you want anything more complex than that?  Why waste film time with plot.  This is about nudity and lots of it.  Too bad some of the girls look better dressed than when naked.

Breastford Wives For all you Softcore Fans, this is a great flick. Yes, the plot leaves for one to be desired, but if you wanted plot, you probably would not be watching this. There is some skin and some pretty hot action scenes. A young couple move to this remote area and three sex hungry young beautiful introduce themselves to the couple. Things take place sexually after that involving the couple (mainly the husband) and the three nymphs. There is a good scene that involves SEX and EXERCISE equipment. I recommend this flick to all you 'scinemax' and 'hotime' after hours fans. Five Stars from me.

As far as Secret Key releases go, at least for the ones directed by Jim Wynorski (or "H.R. Blueberry" in this incarnation), this one is near the top of the mound. And that mound is made out of silicone. Anybody who has seen a few of Wynorski's films should expect that--unlike me, he seems to have a thing for fake breasts. You will see a LOT of them in this film, and a lot of goofy, non-stimulating sex scenes that for the most part seem to be played for laughs. For God's sake, one couple gets it on while sitting in the kitchen sink. You'll also see familiar settings and familiar scenes from other Wynorski films like House on Hooter Hill. I swear, he's done about five movies featuring exactly the same scenes, even with the same actresses in a few cases. There's the bubble-bath hot-tub scene with three naked ladies who make out, the outdoor hot-tub scene with the three naked ladies who slap each other's butts a lot and the outdoor sex scene in that one clearing just off of the road. If you've seen many of his films, you know exactly what I'm talking about. Oh, and Monique Parent, looking as scary as always. She's not my thing, nor is Taylor Wayne who to me appears as if she got quilled by a trayful of collagen-filled syringes. But here's what makes it good: 1) Glori-Anne Gilbert from all sides (for once we get some nice rear shots) 2) A good deal more graphic nudity than we've come to expect from Wynorski, including some from the aforementioned GAG and 3) Pubic hair!!! I definitely don't like the '70s look but I can't stand nothing down there at all, and just about every women in this film has some and SHOWS IT. So, if you can bear with a totally inane script (even worse than what you'd expect from a B movie), I think that most who like this genre will enjoy this one.
